Text: “Excessive fear and self-doubt that were the greatest detractors of personal genius.”
Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki;Sharon L. Lechter
Title: Rich Dad Poor Dad

Text: “I am an old man and have known a great many troubles, but most of them never happened.”
Author: Timothy Ferriss
Title: The 4 Hour Workweek

Text: “Its dehumanizing to have thousands of people passing through our computer screens, so we do things wed never do if those people were sitting next to us.”
Author: Derek Sivers
Title: Anything You Want

Text: “People are focused too much on money and not their greatest wealth, which is their education.”
Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki;Sharon L. Lechter
Title: Rich Dad Poor Dad

Text: “So please dont think you need a huge vision. Just stay focused on helping people today.”
Author: Derek Sivers
Title: Anything You Want

Text: “Everyone wants to go to Heaven, but no one wants to die.”
Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki;Sharon L. Lechter
Title: Rich Dad Poor Dad

Text: “If we define risk as the likelihood of an irreversible negative outcome, inaction is the greatest risk of all.”
Author: Timothy Ferriss
Title: The 4 Hour Workweek

Text: “In order to have what you really want, you must first be who you really are.”
Author: Tim S Grover
Title: Relentless

Text: “Named must your fear be before banish it you can.”
Author: Timothy Ferriss
Title: The 4 Hour Workweek

Text: “You had time but you didnt have attention, so the time had no practical value.”
Author: Timothy Ferriss
Title: The 4 Hour Workweek

Text: “Do not overestimate the competition and underestimate yourself.”
Author: Timothy Ferriss
Title: The 4 Hour Workweek

Text: “Would you tell me, please, which way I ought to go from here? That depends a good deal on where you want to get to, said the Cat. I dont much care where … said Alice. Then it doesnt matter which way you go, said the Cat.”
Author: Timothy Ferriss
Title: The 4 Hour Workweek

Text: “You really wanted to win, but the fear of losing was greater than the excitement of winning.”
Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki;Sharon L. Lechter
Title: Rich Dad Poor Dad

Text: “Energy instead of emotion. Big difference.”
Author: Tim S Grover
Title: Relentless

Text: “If you want to be successful, to have that place in the sun, then you have to leave the shade.”
Author: Tim S Grover
Title: Relentless

Text: “Its what is in your head that determines what is in your hands. Money is only an idea.”
Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki;Sharon L. Lechter
Title: Rich Dad Poor Dad

Text: “It is fatal to know too much at the outcome: boredom comes as quickly to the traveler who knows his route as to the novelist who is overcertain of his plot.”
Author: Timothy Ferriss
Title: The 4 Hour Workweek

Text: “Physical dominance can make you great. Mental dominance is what ultimately makes you unstoppable.”
Author: Tim S Grover
Title: Relentless

Text: “A job is only a short-term solution to a long-term problem. Most people have only one problem in mind, and its short term.”
Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki;Sharon L. Lechter
Title: Rich Dad Poor Dad

Text: “SLEEP FOR CREATIVITY”
Author: Matthew Walker
Title: Why We Sleep

Text: “The world is always handing you opportunities of a lifetime, every day of your life, but all too often we fail to see them.”
Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki;Sharon L. Lechter
Title: Rich Dad Poor Dad

Text: “Trust yourself. Decide.”
Author: Tim S Grover
Title: Relentless

Text: “Ideas are worth nothing unless they are executed.”
Author: Derek Sivers
Title: Anything You Want

Text: “In excess, most endeavors and possessions take on the characteristics of their opposite.”
Author: Timothy Ferriss
Title: The 4 Hour Workweek

Text: “The fear of being different prevents most people from seeking new ways to solve their problems.”
Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki;Sharon L. Lechter
Title: Rich Dad Poor Dad

Text: “Wakefulness is low-level brain damage, while sleep is neurological sanitation.”
Author: Matthew Walker
Title: Why We Sleep

Text: “So if you want to be rich and maintain your wealth, its important to be financially literate, in words as well as numbers.”
Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki;Sharon L. Lechter
Title: Rich Dad Poor Dad

Text: “You cant be relentless if you cant take discomfort, and you cant be unstoppable if you only deal with pressure when you have no choice.”
Author: Tim S Grover
Title: Relentless

Text: “Do what you feel in your heart to be right—for youll be criticized anyway. Youll be damned if you do, and damned if you dont.”
Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki;Sharon L. Lechter
Title: Rich Dad Poor Dad

Text: “Absence of evidence is not evidence of absence.”
Author: Matthew Walker
Title: Why We Sleep

Text: “Excellence is lonely.”
Author: Tim S Grover
Title: Relentless

Text: “One does not accumulate but eliminate. It is not daily increase but daily decrease. The height of cultivation always runs to simplicity.”
Author: Timothy Ferriss
Title: The 4 Hour Workweek

Text: “Rich people buy luxuries last, while the poor and middle class tend to buy luxuries first.”
Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki;Sharon L. Lechter
Title: Rich Dad Poor Dad

Text: “People dont change.”
Author: Tim S Grover
Title: Relentless

Text: “There is nothing the busy man is less busied with than living; there is nothing harder to learn.”
Author: Timothy Ferriss
Title: The 4 Hour Workweek

Text: “All you need to be is generous with what you have, and the powers will be generous with you.”
Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki;Sharon L. Lechter
Title: Rich Dad Poor Dad

Text: “It is what you know that is your greatest wealth. It is what you do not know that is your greatest risk.”
Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki;Sharon L. Lechter
Title: Rich Dad Poor Dad

Text: “People think it must be fun to be a super genius, but they dont realize how hard it is to put up with all the idiots in the world.”
Author: Timothy Ferriss
Title: The 4 Hour Workweek

Text: “To become financially secure, a person needs to mind their own business.”
Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki;Sharon L. Lechter
Title: Rich Dad Poor Dad

Text: “Creation is a better means of self-expression than possession; it is through creating, not possessing, that life is revealed.”
Author: Timothy Ferriss
Title: The 4 Hour Workweek

Text: “Many a false step was made by standing still.”
Author: Timothy Ferriss
Title: The 4 Hour Workweek

Text: “Deep down, you know its all an illusion, but with everyone participating in the same game of make-believe, its easy to forget.”
Author: Timothy Ferriss
Title: The 4 Hour Workweek

Text: “Sleep is not the absence of wakefulness.”
Author: Matthew Walker
Title: Why We Sleep

Text: “There is a difference between being poor and being broke. Broke is temporary, and poor is eternal.”
Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki;Sharon L. Lechter
Title: Rich Dad Poor Dad

Text: “Are you having a breakdown or a breakthrough?”
Author: Timothy Ferriss
Title: The 4 Hour Workweek

Text: “By not having any money to waste, you never waste money.”
Author: Derek Sivers
Title: Anything You Want

Text: “Children spend years in an antiquated educational system, studying subjects they will never use, preparing for a world that no longer exists.”
Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki;Sharon L. Lechter
Title: Rich Dad Poor Dad

Text: “Money doesnt change you; it reveals who you are when you no longer have to be nice.”
Author: Timothy Ferriss
Title: The 4 Hour Workweek

Text: “Many of the explanations for why we sleep circle around a common, and perhaps erroneous, idea: sleep is the state we must enter in order to fix that which has been upset by wake. But what if we turned this argument on its head? What if sleep is so useful—so physiologically beneficial to every aspect of our being—that the real question is: Why did life ever bother to wake up? Considering how biologically damaging the state of wakefulness can often be, that is the true evolutionary puzzle here, not sleep.”
Author: Matthew Walker
Title: Why We Sleep

Text: “Most people are fast to stop you before you get started but hesitant to get in the way if youre moving.”
Author: Timothy Ferriss
Title: The 4 Hour Workweek

Text: “This is your life. How can you not invest in that?”
Author: Tim S Grover
Title: Relentless

Text: “Trust, but verify.”
Author: Derek Sivers
Title: Anything You Want

Text: “They argue instead of asking questions.”
Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki;Sharon L. Lechter
Title: Rich Dad Poor Dad
